body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11767168/62409285-4c248980-b607-11e9-8b23-9fef45ec5482.png)
Why do you query so large page size? This size could trigger elasticsearch error, if you want that, change elasticsearch settings.
/run ci
@kezhenxu94 Accepted. Please approve the PR.

On my test skywalking vertx plugin was not work as it should be.
And It's hard make the plugin work  without change apm-agent-core
Why do you change core? If you have unsupported scenario, submit an issue and discuss in abstract way. Please don't connect to vertx code, we need clear scenario.
I am not following. I need more clear use case.

We have intercept point definitions already. Why do you want to change API?

I noticed you submitted many pull requests, which are all pointing to change APIs. They don't make sense to me. All these things, could be done by current API easily.

You need to understand open source community API basic principles
1. Have clear usage, and as easy as possible.
1. Once it is set, don't change it unless have too.
1. Performance is just perspective, not has to be best. 
1. Changing API is mostly accepted when you are core maintainer,whcih means you could support the project in the future, because every new API means payload to core maintainer team. If everyone could add one, and leave, the core team is impossible to maintainer. So all changes must be in deeply discussion, not just for anyone's convenience.
1. Coding style is not the reason to change APIs. Feature and use case are.
The response is required, otherwise, we have to close the pull request.
Please make sure your submitted PR has been well discussed and have the clear goal. Open too many PR will make you too hard to follow.
Waiting for new ByteBuddy 1.10.1 release.

@candyleer You could read this PR now. And notice the document I added. I am waiting for @raphw 's new release and confirmation(Take a look at our discussion issue at ByteBuddy). If you want to try this, you need to install ByteBuddy master branch by yourself and change the dependency to 1.10.1-SNAPSHOT.
How long have you used the 6.2.0? How many days? Check other indexes, such as service_p99.
How to solve this problem
/run ci
the unit test `TraceSegmentServiceClientTest.testSendTraceSegmentWithException` is not stable after #3181 , it failed two times, I'll try to find out why it failed sometimes
I added a fix for another bug. Prometheus telemetry provider is down.

Any plan for bringing back the login back to Skywalking webapp ui?
We don't want the webapp pages are accessible for anonymous visits.
You could build your login easily. Today, no contributor is trying to bring it back in a security way.

>  How long have you used the 6.2.0? How many days? Check other indexes, such as service_p99.

Thanks for your quick response!! We upgraded our deployment from 6.1.0 to 6.2.0 in July, acutually, we just using it for two weeks, and not always can get the trace logs. I want to find out the reason and fix it.  As your guidence, I checked the indices in ES, I can see blow list: service_p99-20190804
service_p99_hour-20190804
service_p99_month-201907
service_p99_day-20190804

The ES version is 6.3.2.

First, if upgrade happens, have you removed all elasticsearch indexes? Auto created based on elasticsearch template. From you posted, the indexes can't be created, the existing is created by bootstrap.

So make sure your elasticsearch index have been removed.
What is the issue? Layout?

> First, if upgrade happens, have you removed all elasticsearch indexes? Auto created based on elasticsearch template. From you posted, the indexes can't be created, the existing is created by bootstrap.
> 
> So make sure your elasticsearch index have been removed.

We reinstalled ES, SkyWalking OAP and SkyWalking Agent from stratch, the indexes were auto created by SkyWalking 6.2.0.  Do you mean it's not the standard way? We did the compatibility testing based on SkyWalking 6.2.0 and SkyWalking 6.1.0 indexes, and its not works, so we reinstalled everything.

![QQ截图20190805135130](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7775417/62441812-2c689f00-b788-11e9-8134-eda4cac66f41.png)

here is the right version in window chrome

---

i extend the httpclient agent to log request body and response body
but the layout of trace log not work properly
the dark scroll bar stand upon the real context

Re-install could trigger index creation, yes. But after the first day, the index creation is based on ElasticSearch template, which we created too, by using the old index name, such as `service_p99`. Check your ElasticSearch template setting, to see whether it is there.

In my chrome(Mac too), when it shows a long tag, it looks like this way, flowing to another line. Are you tagging value without any whitespace? Scrolling is not the thing we expected.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/62442822-b2d2b000-b78b-11e9-8e91-42fb5e7ca9d2.png)

Also, this feature is added by you, so you need to fix on your own env. We can't make our UI suitable for every env, you could send a pull request to fix that, but I would recommend you to use whitespace and change a new line.

> Re-install could trigger index creation, yes. But after the first day, the index creation is based on ElasticSearch template, which we created too, by using the old index name, such as `service_p99`. Check your ElasticSearch template setting, to see whether it is there.

Thanks for your guidence! We missed the templates creation step! I cannot find the guide about this step, can you provide us an URL?
Template created through codes when OAP start up. If you can't find it in ES, I think maybe you have the old indexes which are sharing the same names.

> Template created through codes when OAP start up. If you can't find it in ES, I think maybe you have the old indexes which are sharing the same names.

I just checked the ES templates, they are all created by default. :)

Then the index should be created when data flows in. It is created based on your metrics/segments etc. If you can't create, maybe something forbids you, I heard (but not be sure), some ElasticSearch service(such as in AliCloud), they have options to disable this auto index creation.

> Then the index should be created when data flows in. It is created based on your metrics/segments etc. If you can't create, maybe something forbids you, I heard (but not be sure), some ElasticSearch service(such as in AliCloud), they have options to disable this auto index creation.

:( We are using AliCloud. I will confirm it. Thank you very much!!!
No response in 4 days, closing

What's more, I comment the filter rule about org.apache.logging. 
I noticed that agent use log4j2 too and relavant instrument is ignored. I simply comment this filter.
Is it OK?
```java
        new AgentBuilder.Default(byteBuddy)
            .ignore(
                nameStartsWith("net.bytebuddy.")
                .or(nameStartsWith("org.slf4j."))
//                .or(nameStartsWith("org.apache.logging."))
                .or(nameStartsWith("org.groovy."))
                .or(nameContains("javassist"))
                .or(nameContains(".asm."))
                .or(nameStartsWith("sun.reflect"))
                .or(allSkyWalkingAgentExcludeToolkit())
                .or(ElementMatchers.<TypeDescription>isSynthetic()))
            .type(pluginFinder.buildMatch())
            .transform(new Transformer(pluginFinder))
            .with(new Listener())
            .installOn(instrumentation);
```
I've seen this problem before, and the solution is set the elasticsearch RestClient.builder socketTimeOut，Specific setting method asks baidu。

1. If you are doing the same thing and covered the old cases, it is OK to delete the existing one.
1. I noticed, there is no document update, is there any change about usage?
1. The agent doesn't use log4j or any other log framework.
1. Why do you comment `.or(nameStartsWith("org.apache.logging."))`? I don't think we are going to instrument log framework, do you?

1. OK
2. no change in usage
3. OK
4. Because I intercept  ```callAppenders``` in  the ```org.apache.logging.log4j.core.async.AsyncLoggerConfig ``` of log4j2 to achieve the goal. Therefore. I comment it  to  make instrument on org.apache.logging.log4j work. I am not sure why it is abondend before and wanna to make sure that comment will not affect other components work normally .:smile:

For (4), because log4j is complex, it sometimes causes issues in agent startup, so we ignore it before. I am not sure whether we will face the issue now. Which versions of log4j2 have you tested? I suggest you to do including some old versions.

As you said, log component plugin is very hard to test, which mostly is based on trust, we can't do the plugin tests as we did for others.

no time for respone this PR
welcome other maintainers continue this work:)
/run e2e

I agree these principles
But the change of the API is for the future ...

The goal of this pr try to improve code reuse -- 增加代码重用度，减少插件中的重复代码
skywalking-plugin.def如支持通过定义传入构建器参数，则只用少数几个通用的AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine子类，然后各插件可通过声明式定义来实现相同功能，重用代码逻辑:)

Also, in many open source projects, including SkyWalking. We don't do design for the future, unless it is a real scenario which we can't support.

I rejected the changes because I don't see the necessary of new APIs. Intercept point APIs are lower the maintain payload when plugin core refactor. DI is better than hierarchy always. Also, how could you support hierarchy enhance? By interface or super class?

Open source APIs need to be consistent abd clear. Your design looks like for internal developers, try to make it easy.
@credit2go-admin Update? We need you to follow the review.

|  Version   | Root  |  AsyncRoot   |
|  ----  | ----  |----  |

| 2.1  |  :heavy_check_mark: |  :heavy_check_mark: |
| 2.0+  |  :x: |  :x: |

1. What's more, for latest version 2.11.1+, async root will not work. I will find out reason lately
1. **While for most common cases, 2.1<=version<=2.11.0,root and asyncroot works well**
1. for 2.0.0, I think it's too old, without the help of log4j-jul(minimum version2.1.0), it cant integrate with spring log framework even. Therefore, it will throw a exception if use 2.0 in springboot app.

Finally, I paste the version distribution of log4j2 as base for consideration
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24379174/62505057-b0289700-b82d-11e9-9a64-184953758ae3.png)

That is another reason, we design the way, which doesn't instrument log framework internal class. It is unstable, but the log requires stable. 

Another optional you could consider, it is doing log public API instrumentation, such as `logger#debug`, add the trace id into the log message.
May I ask which parameter is set to control the days of retained data of sky's es
@1346735074 Read the document posted above, it is all there.
@wu-sheng Yes, I have read this document, but it is not clear that it is controlled by that parameter
@1346735074 Like the doc said, there are several, not just one single parameter.

@wu-sheng Yes, because of multiple parameters, it is not clear which parameter can achieve the desired effect, the comments are not obvious
```
recordDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_RECORD_DATA_TTL：7} ＃单位为天
    otherMetricsDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_OTHER_METRIC_DATA_TTL：45} ＃单位为天
    monthMetricsDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_MONTH_METRIC_DATA_TTL：18} ＃机组是月
```

@1346735074 Because there are several dimensionalities. Such as 
1. The metrics data in month level, it is impossible to set the TTL as day to control it, right?
1. The record including alarm and trace details, so it is huge data, it can't be kept as same as metrics usually. 

So there are 3 kinds of TTL settings.

@wu-sheng Well, I want to know what these three parameters mean，
recordDataTTL
otherMetricsDataTTL
monthMetricsDataTTL

@1346735074 Do you basically know how SkyWalking save data?
1. Record type, trace segment, alarm
1. Metrics in different dimensionalities. Minute, Hour, Day, Month.
1. Inventory. Metadata. Can't be erased by TTL.

recordDataTTL -> (1), otherMetricsDataTTL -> (2) in Minute, Hour, Day, monthMetricsDataTTL -> (2) in monthMetricsDataTTL.

@wu-sheng Do the following Settings refer to 7 days of failure clearance?
```
    recordDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_RECORD_DATA_TTL：7} ＃单位为天
    otherMetricsDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_OTHER_METRIC_DATA_TTL：45} ＃单位为天
    monthMetricsDataTTL： $ {SW_STORAGE_ES_MONTH_METRIC_DATA_TTL：18} ＃机组是月
```
I don't understand your question.
@wu-sheng If 7 days are set to clear the data of es, what are the corresponding Settings of these three parameters
@wu-sheng The default of these three parameters is how long to clear es
Yes, this only supports 6.3.2-6.8.2, not 7.0

> Another optional you could consider, it is doing log public API instrumentation, such as `logger#debug`, add the trace id into the log message.

So do you mean, I cound try to intercpet another class, some common log API, which is not included in "org.apache.logging."? Ok I will try to find this solution. While, I doubt it may be not ideal as this solution cause it has to intercept common API rather than some relavant API, which more targeted and clear.

In this update:
1. Binding `RootHandlerInterceptor` and `RoutingHandlerInterceptor` both.
2. Changed cutpoint `io.undertow.server.Connectors.executeRootHandler ` to `io.undertow.Undertow.Builder.setHandler`.
3. In `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.undertow.v2x.RootHandlerInterceptor`, when method's(`io.undertow.Undertow.Builder.setHandler`) head element of arguments is `RoutingHandle` do nothing, else override this element to `TracingHandler`

change what?
I has changed the time but it does not work

It is a historical issue. In Java, we used to call it JDBC, but the instrumentations of Database access are targeting the JDBC interface, so be called as JDBI(JDBC-Interface), but today it is totally not the case:)

Old name mismatch today's name. But considering the forward-compatible, we haven't any change to change it.
Btw, OpenTracing calls this JDBI too, even I don't think it doesn't make much sense.
@wu-sheng I was updated the PR. Could you re-run `ci` and `e2e`?

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/8/aiyanbo/testReport-master-2019-08-07-14-52.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-test/217/artifact/workspace/logs/validate_2019-08-07-14-52.log)
@kezhenxu94 @candyleer Tests passed. Please review codes again. including this test case PR, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/pull/80.

For your queue question, I don't it is multiple threads visible issue. You are using 6.0.0-GA, back to there, OAP created several threads(including queue) to deal with one kind of metrics, such as service_p99, service_p95. But actually, we don't need that much, in 6.1.0 -> 6.3.0(release soon), we have optimized the thread model very much, we have a new shared consumer thread pool to avoid the root cause, which is also the root cause of your scenario, that is too many unnecessary threads, triggering high CPU load.

You could dig a little more about the master branch, to see what we are doing today. From the thread dump we get from the latest version, consumer threads are still more than necessary, but we wouldn't keep to too low to support very high payload/throughput in OAP.

Check the TTL document in backend setup and how you set in your core module. Default, the trace data only saved in 90 mins in 6.1.0. From 6.2.0+, it is set much longer in default and placed in ElasticSearch storage module.
